intro: Cerastium comatum, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous habitats. Cerastium comatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
